intro: Pleurostelma grevei, commonly known as the Greve's pleurostelma, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of white or pale yellow blooms during the summer months. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated by gardeners interested in exotic plants.
